required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extended Criteria For Fetal Myelomeningocele Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Extended Criteria For Fetal Myelomeningocele Repair: A Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to offer pre-natal Myelomeningocele (MMC) repair surgery to mothers with a BMI of 35-40 kg/m2 (extending the Management of Myelomeningocele Study (MOMs) criteria for BMI) and to evaluate the efficacy and safety of this extension, by capturing clinical and outcome information.

primary_outcome.measure: Complications associated with Obesity in Pregnancy and Surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of fetal repair surgery to 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Determine if there is an increased risk in mothers with a BMI of 35-40 who've undergone open fetal repair for myelomeningocele.

arm_group.description: Patients will undergo open fetal repair surgery for myelomeningocele. Our group will meet all criteria previously set by the MOMs trial with the exception of body mass index (BMI). BMI will be extended to 35-40 kg/m2 in this trial. Intervention: Open Fetal Repair of Myelomeningocele

intervention.description: Maternal Fetal Surgery for Open Neural Tube Defect in women with a BMI of 35 to 40kg/m2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any woman with a prenatal diagnoses of myelomeningocele.
- Pre-pregnancy BMI of 35-40 kg/m2.
- same MOMs Trial inclusion criteria (with the exception of BMI)
Exclusion Criteria:
- poor glycemic control (i.e., HbA1c â‰¥ 8%) in spite a medical antidiabetic therapy in accordance with good clinical practice (GCP)
- presence of significant co-morbidities or complications (such as dyslipidemia, uncontrolled arterial hypertension, impaired renal function, neuropathy, retinopathy, CVD)
- severe diabetes complications or associated medical conditions (such as blindness, endstage renal failure, liver cirrhosis, malignancy, chronic congestive heart failure)
- recent (within preceding 12 months) myocardial infarction, stroke or TIA
- unstable angina pectoris
- same MOMs Trial exclusion criteria (with the exception of BMI)

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston - UTHealth.

link.description: The Fetal Center at Children's Memorial Hermann Hospital

reference.citation: Adzick NS, Thom EA, Spong CY, Brock JW 3rd, Burrows PK, Johnson MP, Howell LJ, Farrell JA, Dabrowiak ME, Sutton LN, Gupta N, Tulipan NB, D'Alton ME, Farmer DL; MOMS Investigators.. A randomized trial of prenatal versus postnatal repair of myelomeningocele. N Engl J Med. 2011 Mar 17;364(11):993-1004. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa1014379. Epub 2011 Feb 9.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
